beaver noun [C]
(ANIMAL)
Add to word list
Add to word list
an animal with smooth fur, sharp teeth, and a large, flat tail. Beavers build dams (= walls of sticks and earth) across rivers.

Beavers [ U ] (also Beaver Scouts)
in the UK, Canada, and some other countries, an organization for children aged about 6 to 8 that encourages them to take part in different activities, especially outside, and to learn skills. It is part of an international organization called the Scouts: I like going to Beavers, drawing, and swimming.
See more
[ C ] (also Beaver Scout) a child who is a member of the Beavers organization: Around the age of 8 you will move up from being a Beaver to being a Cub. My daughter, a Beaver Scout, will take part in a family camp with other young people.
More examplesFewer examplesTina finished work late which made her late taking Joe to Beavers.When you join Beavers, you’ll be introduced to lots of new activities, people and things.The premises are used by Cubs, Beavers and Scouts.
